statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Columbia 64, Canisius 58
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Freshman Brett Loscalzo more than doubled his career-high with 19 points and Columbia beat Canisius 64-58 on Thursday in the third-place game of the Holiday Festival. The win was the first for the Lions (7-3) at Madison Square Garden since beating New York University 70-56 in 1988, and got them within three of matching last season's total. The start is Columbia's best since going 8-3 in 1978-79. The loss was the seventh straight for the Golden Griffins (1-8). Loscalzo, a 6-foot point guard, and Dragutin Kravic each had two 3-pointers in the 15-0 run that gave Columbia a 57-48 lead with 2:25 to play. Canisius went 0-for-7 from the field and committed four turnovers -- three on offensive fouls -- during Columbia's run. Loscalzo's fourth and final 3-pointer made it 56-48 with 3:33 to play and was the Lions' last field goal of the game. They went 8-for-14 from the free throw line the rest of the way. Loscalzo, who came in averaging 4.6 points with a high of nine against Sacred Heart earlier in the month, was 6-of-7 from the field, including 4-for-5 from 3-point range, and had five assists. Matt Preston added 12 points for Columbia, which lost 84-74 to No. 17 North Carolina State in the opening round. Kravic had nine points, all on 3-pointers. Chuck Harris and Dewitt Doss each had 15 points for Canisius, which lost 71-51 to St. John's in the first round. Darnell Wilson had nine points and 12 rebounds. The Golden Griffins finished with a 41-32 advantage on the boards. The tournament is sponsored by Dreyfus.
